Speaker: Dryad
Text: Hold Undead

Speaker: Dryad
Text: I did not so much get into adventuring as it was forced upon me.

Speaker: Ilyich
Text: Be alert, laddies! We've got company. Ho, prisoners! Ye've come to th' wrong place, I tell ye true! Ilyich and 'is boys'll stop you!

Speaker: Ilyich
Text: Suffice to say, this place is your doom. By the time the master returns, you shall be dead and we shall be rewarded. At 'em, lads! No mercy!

Speaker: Ilyich
Text: I won't be givin' 'em to you. Come and get 'em... if you can!

Speaker: Ilyich
Text: At 'em, lads! No mercy!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I can help you too. Should I not try? I hate to see you cooped up like that.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Minsc, that is horrible! I am so sorry for you.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Eww, I... really don't want to think about that too much.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I... I know this room. I've been in here... we both have. He... There are things in these tanks. They used to be people...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: What kind of monster is this guy? Captures us easy as pie, kills whoever he wants... that could have been us in those glass things.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I don't know about that, Minsc, but he sure is a cute little fuzzy wuzzy. Aren't you, Boo?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We don't even know where we are, and my head is still doing funny things... He said something... something about potential.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Are we? Horrible, horrible things surround us, and my head still hurts like crazy. I want to know what he did to me. I remember... something about potential.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He said it about you too: something about power that can be unleashed. I don't care; I just have to get out. Can we leave this room? It bothers me.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I want to know what he did to me too. My head still hurts really bad. He said... said something about potential... about you too.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Wow, a golem. Powerful magic stuff. Odd that it's not hostile. I suppose its maker didn't expect us to escape, so it never got orders for restraining us.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: They only do exactly what they are directed to; they don't really think. If it hasn't been told to keep quiet, we might get some information out of it.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: What...? What is this place? It's—it's beautiful! Oh... there is simply no way that this space belongs to the same person that owns those horrible glass containers.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: No, it can't be. Not the person I know. This... this bed, that table... I know of them. He would... he would speak of them while... while he...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: It's for a lost love, kept in perfect condition. She... she despises him. This is his monument to her. He spoke of all of this, but... but his voice was cold...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: No emotion at all, not even remembered. He spoke of these things even while he cut... he cut... and the spells that wove through my brain... cold, ugly things!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: It still hurts... his sick fingers are still in my head, doing whatever it was he started. I see blood... and death... behind my eyes... Irenicus...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: This room: If he could care for anything, he would care for this room. Above the lives of all of us. It makes me sick. I feel... I feel... so much hate.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I would burn this place, but it is nothing. Even as it means so much, it is nothing. Let's do what we must and get out of this place; it is making me sick.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We are nothing; that's why the golems don't care. Why bother worrying about gnats? Besides, he doesn't need to catch us. I can tell. I can feel it.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Duergar, I think. Kind of evil, I guess, so I'm not surprised they would be working for our captor.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: For the knives, probably. The knives... he has a lot of them... I'm going to have a couple of scars from this... looks like you will too.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I doubt he cares for anything more than the quality of knives they make. He has a lot of them... I'm going to have scars from this... looks like you will too.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Jaheira... I wanna say how sorry I am about Khalid. I... I know this is hard...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Stop calling me "child." I'm as old as you, and besides, I can tell you that Khalid did not suffer.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I'm not babbling! I saw him do this! Khalid was dead when our captor started... doing those things to him!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He... he showed me. He cut and... and showed me. He forced my eyes open and made me look as he...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He said I should see, so I would understand, but I don't know what he wanted! He would cut and say "Do you see?" Cut and say "Do you see?"

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I am not a child! I'm as old as you, and I've... I've seen. I can see...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I see now... in my head... cut, "yes, I see..."

Speaker: Imoen
Text: So beautiful! I used to dream of dryads and their beautiful trees.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I used to dream... but he doesn't. Your charms don't work on him anymore, do they?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Irenicus...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: No, death sounds different. He showed me... I spit on his name. I spit on this place.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I have learned... something different. So beautiful you are. I almost can't see you. I just want to go home. Oh, when can we go home?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I've gotta hand it to you... you sure have some kind of courage to sleep in this place. I would've run screaming a dozen times over if you weren't here.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I guess I should be used to sleeping with both eyes open. I don't deal with this well. We're alike because of Gorion, but I prefer being in the background.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He was a great mage, and supposedly a great adventurer. It's funny; we lived with him for years, and Jaheira seems to know more about him.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I guess he was a big friend of the Harpers. Even got a visit from Khelben "Blackstaff" once. Real powerful mage. Talked to Gorion like an equal.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I wish we could go back to those days, before all this fuss and bother. Before I learned... Well, we've seen so much. Candlekeep seems so small now.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Seems like we're not important enough to worry about. I'm just not up to this like you. We're alike because of Gorion, but I prefer being in the background.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Does it? Then I feel better. I figured I didn't deal with this as well as you. We're alike because of Gorion, but I prefer being in the background.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Well, when people are in danger, sure. Winthrop taught me how to get out of trouble, but Gorion always said there are times when it's worth getting into it.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Yeah, you're right. I don't want to spend a second more in this place than I have to. My head still hurts, and I keep seeing things in corners and such.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We won't be able to just walk away, you know. The guy that captured us... he knows about you. He said something about potential, something about great power.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Funny, that. I was sorry to go, but I couldn't let you wander off on your own, now could I? After Gorion d... died, you needed all the help you could get.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Not that I'm much help right now. My head still aches, and I keep seeing things. Too much death around here, everywhere. It's in everything, even me.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: We still had friends there. They were proud, even if they didn't show it. Winthrop said so. He always thought Gorion was too stuffy. I don't know though.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Ooh, my head still hurts, and I keep thinking I see... things in the corners. Too much death here for my liking. It's in everything, even us.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: What a tortured creature that clone thing was. She was a copy? A copy of another person?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I wonder why Irenicus made her? I doubt he took pleasure in her company; he's beyond that. He's fascinated with death. He showed me... over and over...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Oh... this reminds me so much of Candlekeep. Dusty old tomes all over, bookcases nearly spilling. It's... like we never left...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: But we did, didn't we? I just want to go home again. It doesn't matter where it is, just so long as I can call it home.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Those dwarves that attacked us—I read about them when you were skipping out of lessons back in Candlekeep.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Something strange up here. Be careful, this place has all manner of dangerous devices in it. I don't know what they do, but I know we would be safer if we shut them off.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Do you smell that? Smells like lightning, but indoors? That can't be right. I think I remember. Look to the right... the machine making the storm...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Get out of my way! I don't want to fight any of you; I just want to leave!

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Athkatla? That's... the City of Coin, right? A merchant city in Amn. We come from the Sword Coast, a ways to the north. Why do you think we're in Athkatla?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Say we won't look back. I don't care if he can "tap the power" or access whatever avatar stuff. We've gotta get away from all this death.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Means a lot to hear that. I can't stand all these shadows...

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I appreciate that, but I doubt he meant you any good either. Didn't spare you the knives any more than me. Come on, I gotta get away from all these shadows.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: Let it go, please? Whoever he is and whatever he can do, above it all, he's a vile bastard that's hurt us both. Come on, I gotta get away from all this death.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: He said something like "releasing power within you so it could be used," but if it means taking part in horrible things... I don't like this place. Can we go?

Speaker: Imoen
Text: I don't care if he could make us three ogres strong, I have to get out of this place. It bothers me. Makes me think I see... things.

Speaker: Imoen
Text: As if I need another reminder. I don't care what power this guy thinks he can tap in you, he's just sick to the core. We can't ever look back.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Kha... Khalid?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Khalid... No! This... this is an illusion... a dream... a bad dream...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Sil... Silvanus guide the light... to the source. Take this man to what he justly deserves. By... nature's will, what was given is returned; what was turmoil is now... is now peace.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We... we must hurry before we are noticed. We must get out of this... this grave... and seek the light above. Let us go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will watch your tongue lest I rip it from your mouth! I, more than anyone, know of the ways life may return, but there is a line that cannot be crossed!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We live in a time of miracles, and nature allows the rebirth of many that have passed beyond the veil, but there is a time when... when it is better to let go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will mourn according to what I believe. His death... his death is horrible, but I am still trapped and we are still in danger. Should sorrow doom us all?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nature is a cycle of birth and... death. Interrupting that cycle isn't... natural! Ah, there's no time for this! I will mourn, but we must still rescue ourselves!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That is the way of things. There will be... there will be payment for this crime, and I shall not rest until it is collected. When we are able, there will be...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Enough. I would leave this place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will not suffer this! You will learn the limits and understand, but I will not bear this idiocy now! Find your own path; I will not travel with you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will learn. There are things that cannot change, and others that cannot remain. And others...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Another day! We must live to pose a bigger threat! There is no point joining the fray today; we would only end up dead or back in our cells. Another day...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of course I am afraid; what fool wouldn't be? We were captured with little difficulty, held with even less, and have escaped with friends dead or wounded.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We will exact vengeance when it is to our advantage. I will not start a losing battle. A guaranteed loss is a fool's endeavor. Another day... another day...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Only an idiot is not afraid when they should be. We were captured and held with ease! Yes, we have earned our freedom, but it was at the cost of our friends!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Agreed. We will exact justice when we have hope of succeeding. Until then... I will not forget. Another time and place...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know this place... these buildings. Yes, that person was assuredly correct; this is Athkatla. We are in the state of Amn.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, Athkatla is along the lower edge of the Sword Coast. I wonder whom we angered that we should be brought here? We should lay low, perhaps in the slums.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Regardless, we will have to make sure we are out of sight for a while. I might know a few safe places here and there, by the docks or outside of town.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Whatever our enemy, we should keep low for a while. Perhaps at the docks or out of town. I might know a few places.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I would suggest the slums. There will be low-profile work, especially at the Copper Coronet. Someone might have heard of our capture or know where Imoen is.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You might have never been here, but I have. Those Who Harp tend to travel. Khalid... Khalid and I came here... well, let us just say I have been here before.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I am sorry? Do I know you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Forgive me, but I will require a little more information. Your name again?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No... no, I am terribly sorry, but your face is unfamiliar. Perhaps if you told me what you do...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I remember well, but I wanted you to say it, and I wanted others to hear. Quite the outburst, Mister Ployer. I assume you are still at odds with your new life?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: MISTER Ployer, I wanted you *dead* instead of merely humiliated! The courts did not seem to think death was warranted, so they claimed your assets instead.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He is none of your concern. If you value your teeth, you will not speak that name again. You dirty it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, the slander is going a bit far. You actually were a slaver, you know. It's not slander if it's proven.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I don't think that word means what you think it means. You really were trading in slaves, you know? How am I libelous...?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What have you just done, Ployer? Speak!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nobody made you a slaver; you just loved the profit! Now you blame those that caught you because you cannot take responsibility? You are a weak, weak man!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: By the horns of Silvanus, I'll plant him beneath the Stones of Aisath if I... if I...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, I... I'm fine. I just felt a little strange for a moment. That... that fat excuse for a slaver, he's cursed me! Damn him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Try not to shout, please? My head is unsettled at the moment. There... it clears somewhat, but undoubtedly there will be more. That fat old slaver cursed me!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: For the moment, though I do feel a touch under the weather. Damn him! I'll see his slaving heart stopped for this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I doubt he would have bothered if the cure were quite so simple. If this curse was tailored to me, then we've no recourse but to exact its cure from his hide.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The Harpers do not operate like that. No, I bet only the one who cast it can remove it. It likely resists conventional means if it was tailored to me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I beg your pardon? I am to be cast out because of this? What is your reasoning?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That may be my only option. If it was tailored to me, it might resist removal by normal means. I doubt Ployer would have done this if the solution were simple.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have a few options. Ployer mentioned that he lived in squalor, suggesting he may be in the poor section of the city. Not likely to find him quick though.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He also mentioned Belgrade, a merchant that helped expose Ployer. He frequents the Copper Coronet, and the bartender Bernard might know his whereabouts.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He also mentioned Belgrade, a merchant that helped expose Ployer. He frequents the Copper Coronet, and the bartender Bernard might know his whereabouts.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: True, there is a lot of ground to cover, but it seemed clear that he lives in squalor. I would begin in the poor sections of the city. It will take some time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Again this side of you surfaces. I should not have believed your apologies in Irenicus's dungeon. I will not spend a... *cough*... a moment more in your company!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You *cough* surprise me. To think this cold streak was within and I had only glimpsed it until now. Well then, I will cause you no more inconvenience.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That is not *cough* amusing, and it's not the first time you have acted such. Perhaps you are colder than you let on, but I have little choice but to follow.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: There is always a better path than simply abandoning those that are weak. You will not keep allies by demonstrating that you are willing to sacrifice them.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very well, though I should like to try and find Belgrade eventually. It has been... *cough*... it has been some time since we talked.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A good first step. Hopefully he can give us some idea where Ployer might... *cough*... might be.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ooohhh... mm! I did not find resting at all comfortable last eve. I... *cough*... I just couldn't bring my eyes to close. My head pounds as thunder behind my temples.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Aye, that I am, but well enough to walk. I will see that Ployer pay for this. Blasted slaver!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am rested well enough. I will not coddle this curse. Sleeping may ease the aching, but it won't help remove it. Only finding that Ployer will do that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Lazy, am I? I wouldn't wish a wasting on many, but you come close. Ah, I have no time to bicker. We must continue on lest this affliction progress too far.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. So despite assurances, you are indeed the bastard I thought you were after that stunt in Irenicus's jail. Oh, I remember, and I'll remember this too.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not joke so! I am in grave straits, and you mock my condition with talk of leaving?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You can get me Ployer. Never have I been so mad at another living thing. All this because he could not admit responsibility. He is irredeemable.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. Then I will waste no more of your time. I will seek help on my own, and damn you for being so cold. Farewell. We will not meet again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: My very bones ache today. It is as though I age on the inside. Ohh, this cannot go on for long.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh, I shall certainly save it. I shall save it just long enough to bring the fury of Mother Earth upon that fat slaver that would imprison her children.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What do you mean by that? Am I not worth the effort of rescue? Have you better things to do?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Forgive my outburst as well; I am... *cough*... I am not myself. Come, we must go. I will see that slaver pay for this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Despicable... *cough* *cough*... despicable wretch! You knew I would come here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am... I am not here to grovel, Ployer. You would sooner get that from my corpse!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I— *COUGH* I AM NOT HERE TO GROVEL! I may be weak, even dying, but you WON'T get that! I have come to take what is mine! I (ehrm) will be free of you... of your...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I feel... weak, but better. I... *cough* *cough*... I thank you for helping me through this. You have earned my gratitude and... ehh... and I should really get a full day of rest.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ahh, yes, I'm the one with enemies we need to worry about. Do you even believe that yourself? Don't make me lau... ow... laugh.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I certainly hope so. Such weakness... I swear, if I meet his like again, I'll not let the courts spare him. I'll... I'll be better after a night's rest.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Like him? No. Well, perhaps, though he was certainly one of the more wretched. I doubt we'll see any more like him, though we'll never want for enemies.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *yawn*... I'm... I live to see the Earthmother's dawn once more? Then... then you have succeeded. Excellent. And Ployer? What of him?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Good riddance. It was years overdue. Most of his ilk in my past suffered a more final version of Harper justice. Let us go; I have sat about too long.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The mages with him wore odd colors that might be traceable. Ask at the government building, as all magic is regulated in Athkatla. If they will talk...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No deals for a slayer of Harpers.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I'm... I'm fine, Bernard. I just need...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Bernard, I'm FINE. I just need... need some information. I need to find Belgrade.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Bernard, please. I need to know where they found Belgrade. I also need to know if you have seen Baron Ployer.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see... Thank you, Bernard. I... I really must be going now.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Drenden, I... I am dying.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No arguments from... from me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Drenden, they have done nothing to me... I am... cursed. It cannot be removed. I cannot... I feel...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It's... all right. Find... find Ployer and...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I said not to...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You do not need to...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I make claim that you are an affront to all nature. You are a disruption that will not be allowed, and I will fight with the power of my faith and conviction.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will accept this challenge, and we will proceed! I will not have this place remain in your "care"! By the Great Mother, you will not leave the duel alive!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What is this "clap" you speak of, child? Enough. Begone, you are disturbing me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He... Khalid... is dead, and has been so for some time! Beyond a point, there can be no raising, especially when the body has been... has been desecrated!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, there are greater spells that raise even the aged dead, but they leech from the caster, and I will not ask that of someone! Khalid would not have it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We live in a time of miracles, and nature allows the rebirth of many that have passed beyond the vale, but there is a time when... when it is better to let go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will not speak ill of my life with Khalid! I will answer such insults with lethal intent, and rightfully so! You cannot know... you cannot!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your opinion is of a fool that thinks magic and spells are the ultimate forces that shape our lives! You will learn that some... some things are unalterable!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We cannot prevail here; best we leave until we can. Another day, another place; there will be righteous vengeance, but in its own time. Oh yes... in time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I doubt we would have come this far if a battle were not distracting our host! We will exact punishment when we can; there is no point in dying here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I expect less of you with each utterance. I have said what I know, and you can take it or leave it. Ask around and you will know I speak the truth.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I was wondering the same, though we are not all that far from home and organizations can span continents. Perhaps it is not an individual that seeks our heads.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not know the city well enough to give directions though. We will have to seek out the slums. Perhaps we may find who holds Imoen still.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps in the slums, we will find who planned this, or who has Imoen still. I have heard that the Copper Coronet is a good place to find information.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I can speak for myself, human. And I can assure you that I am not "available," as you put it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do I know of you? Have you reason to subject me to your rude manner? I have no coin, if that is your wish.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not follow by a stranger's command. Who are you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... Yes, I see. If you would give me a moment, I will do what needs be done.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Relax, I will not be gone long. Please, I will explain when I return. I... I do not wish to be apart from you too long. I will return when I can.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Try not to worry, I can take care of myself. I will return as soon as possible. I have obligations elsewhere that must be attended to.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have obligations elsewhere. Worry not, I will return shortly. You will survive without me for a time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No one is disputing that, but I do have obligations outside the group. I will return when I am able.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Remember your obligations elsewhere. We have to go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla as soon as possible. It would not be good to keep them waiting too long.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We should make our way to the Harper Hold in Athkatla as soon as we are able. I do not look forward to the trip any more than you do, but we must.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Please, it is very important that we go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. They were very insistent that I bring you there, and we must go soon.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am a Harper in my heart; you know this. It is my duty to bring you to them, but... but I no more want to make the trip than you do. Nevertheless, we must go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very true, but I am a Harper, as you know. They ask that I bring you. I will not make you go, and I will not leave you, but eventually we must.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Harpers will wait an eternity for vengeance or justice, though defining the two is sometimes difficult. They made it clear I was to bring you to them.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Please, do not make this difficult. I have a duty to take you, and I will not rest easy until we have gone. I will not force you, but eventually we must go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your welcome is forced, Galvarey. You know I am here at the bidding of the Herald. Why have you come to greet me? This is too important to waste time on you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are no Herald! What is going on here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know you are an ambitious fool. You cannot be sanctioned to do this. Even this gaudy base is against our usual restraint. The position of Herald requires...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Fine, set about with your questions so I can get on with my job as well.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Galvarey, siblings we are in Harper blood, but if you do not cease your tongue, I shall remove it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Mind yourself, this is very serious.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Please, do not make this difficult for yourself.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are twisting their words, Galvarey. That is not what they meant.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Why do you ask the question if you are going to infuse the answer with your own meaning? you would never...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is a difficult situation! Would you react any different?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What has *that* to do with anything?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also the sky, or the ocean! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also of apples, or the rose! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also of the sun above, or the daisy! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And also of the night sky, or the coat of a fine steed! You are so intent on seeing what you wish the answer does not matter!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Thank you, but no. Tonight I am fine as I am.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: But you were to see you as they are, not as you expected them to be! I was to bring them here so...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sorry, this was not my intent at all! I thought...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: My... what? You are questioning me? You subject him to this... this witch hunt and you think I am the one that is to be questioned?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And what if they will restore the balance? What if their intent is good?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nay, Galvarey, there is but you and your four lackeys. I will have no part in this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I will stand by your side if you will have me. You are... you are better than this, I know. I...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So... so be it, then. I will... I must not... I will have no part in either side of this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: These are no friends of mine! I do not recognize them!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Harpers may interfere, but it is for the greater good! Not this! I don't know you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are my comrade in arms. I know you are good and true in heart. I will fight with you against this!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am Harper. I cannot fight by your side against my own, but I will not take part in this! I... I cannot side with either. Goodbye.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What? If this is about the attack at the Harper Hold, you know I would not do such a thing if I had any alternative! They left me no choice!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It was Galvarey; he had me bring my companion there on the pretense of determining their danger, but he had no intention of letting you leave once there.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If that is your wish. Reviane, suffice to say that Galvarey had an unhealthy interest in my compatriot. You must trust me in this matter.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have proven that they are not a slave to their origins, just as Galvarey proved that calling oneself a Harper is not enough to make you one in your heart.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You must do as you will, Reviane. I have told you my circumstance; there is little more for me to say.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If you attack, you are no better than Galvarey. I will meet your threats with whatever force that I can! Do not do this. Harpers seek the truth...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will not draw arms against you, Reviane. This has been a huge mistake, and I will not be party to making another.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As am I, Reviane.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Der... Dermin? Is that you? It has been some time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of... of course, you were the one that introduced me to the Harpers.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What... what are you getting at, Dermin?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. And what power has decided that I should be killed? I serve nature and protect the good of the land through my work as a Harper. Who have I offended?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have washed my hands of the incident in the Harper Hold. Galvarey was in the wrong and brought his fate upon himself.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He was in the wrong! Of that I am certain! Galvarey sought to imprison you for his own gain, and I took the side of right. I could do no other!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is wrong, Dermin. This is not the right solution.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not concern yourself. This was the only course open, even if... I... I wish to not talk of this. This matter is... is behind me. Onward, we have much to do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I thank you, but part of me is gone. I... I will speak no more of this. This is behind me. I must go forward. Come, we have friends to avenge.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin... I...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin, I cannot do as you ask. You are in the wrong, as was Galvarey. I was right to choose your side, and it is your loss if you cannot see this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is not justice. This is revenge for a lie, a falsehood that none seem bothered to find the truth behind. If this is Harper justice, then I...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If this is the justice you represent, then I... I renounce you. I renounce... I renounce my life as a Harper.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It would seem I am the only one that has thought any of this through. You do not, Galvarey did not, and now the Harpers out for blood do not.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I mourn many fellows of the Harp, but they died fighting for balance and truth. Galvarey did not, and this matter cheapens their loss. I will not be party to it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is their... it is my duty to "meddle," you. It is only this instance where they are wrong. I cannot go along with this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No... no... I do not think it is. You are advocating revenge without thought. You are not giving the balance its due. I... I have little choice here, I think.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin... Dermin, I renounce my life as a Harper.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are right, of course, and they have proven it. No, I think it best if I return to tending the balance with my druidic brethren.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That it is. I know you will not upset the balance, but if you change, we will meet again. I will not be happy if you cheapen my choice here today.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It shall not be peaceful, but it is clearer than the course you are on. Goodbye, Dermin.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Garbage? Do you comprehend the magnitude of what I have done? Do you see... what... no, I will not cheapen this moment by arguing with you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Find your own way. See to it that you continue the course we began. Do not make a liar of me, or we will meet again under violent circumstances.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are no burden; you are why I go on. I have friends to avenge, but life is also for the living. My life is worth pursuing. I... I hope you agree.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Come, enough sadness for the day. We have much to do, and... and together we will not fail.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I take strength from the group, but... more so in your company. I have friends to avenge, but life is also for the living. Life is worth pursuing. I... I hope you agree.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Not the way they tell it, Bernard. You know me, so trust in what I do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then do so. I wish this matter behind me once and for all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I don't know.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Undoubtedly. I would do as such again without hesitation. you are proven decent, and others are all the more fools for not seeing so.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I believe I have placed a proper name to your manner, now that I have experienced it up close. I should have thought you fond of anagrams, "Terminsel."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Don't make deals with this scum! He won't keep his—mmmph!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You lying son of a mMMPH!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Fight as best you can—I am free of him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Gllgghh!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No! Blast you filthy bogslimes! Not again!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Fight! I am free of him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You... you...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You... you were pretty quick to give up your equipment.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are... are you all right?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You IDIOT! Do you realize how easily he could have killed me? That was the most irresponsible thing I have EVER had the misfortune of seeing!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Rest assured I'll not forget that! It's a wonder my head is still attached, or that yours ever was! Stand well back of me; I'm doubly careful from now on!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Regardless, I had thought you made of sterner mettle. I was mistaken, and will not expect as such from ye again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Good, I am so glad... you IDIOT! What were you thinking? You could have been killed! An arrow can pierce the heart or the eyes while you stand like a pincushion!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *ahem*... I lost Khalid... to a pointless death. I'm not going... to lose you too.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh, shut up and let's get out of here. We'll... we'll talk later.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You'll keep your hands to yourself, lowly one, or have them cut off!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not test me, rogue. I have not the patience for it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You should go then, small one. The world is as easily accessible to you as one foot placed in front of the other.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You should rub your drunken eyes, then, human sailor. And then avert them, for you are close to offending me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I would sooner jump into a whirlpool than to sit here for endless hours, as you must surely do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do you also find sensual my disdain for your disgusting manner?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I could set you on fire with more than that, if you truly wish.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The first thing of sense you have said. Now stay out of my way.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That you live in poverty is gratifying, if you must live at all! I would suggest you change your tone. I am not in a mood for giving charity to old slavers!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I take it I am the one being addressed here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I would say you are a fool trying to sell something you do not own and a wastrel attempting to take advantage of the innocent.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is because of dirt such as you that I do not like coming to the city. Do not speak to me again, criminal.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What is this? Why do you exhibit such an unpleasant demeanor? What have my people done to deserve such hatred from you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I lead no one to evil, human. And we elves have reason to be proud... we are an old race, far older than you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are a fool, human, and I've no reason to discuss anything with you further.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are... are you speaking of me? And Khalid? How do you know of this? Answer me!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You should be careful, woman... you might miss him more than you think should your wish come true.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Not all elves are "flighty"... in their many years, they learn all too well the responsibilities and pitfalls of this world. You would do well to remember that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Have no fear for me, my friend. I am well capable of defending myself... and punishing those who commit such acts on others!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is not the magic that is evil, but the purpose behind it, and the purpose of many magic users is good... something I am sure even you have benefited from somehow.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: N-no, that's quite all right. Do not make a fuss.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Heh...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What a... charming fellow. Completely insane of course. Out of his mind. Blind as a bat. No idea what he was saying.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes. Well.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Let's... let's get going shall we?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The... the locket is lovely, by the way. Thank you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin? What are you doing back here? I am glad to see you; I had thought our friendship...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What? Such a thing has never been done!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What do you mean?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very well, Dermin. I will think on this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, that was decidedly unpleasant, and more than I wish to worry about.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of... of course. It would be senseless. It does put a different light on things though. I will give this much thought indeed.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am going to do exactly what I said I would do. I am going to think about this. All of this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have known him a long time. He was a mentor when I had none. I will think on this a long time. All of this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Stop!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do you see him? Ready yourself.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Dermin! I would speak at you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Shut up! I said I would speak AT you! This matter is finished! I will not acknowledge this again! If you press it, I will be forced to deal with you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, actually, and you well know it! Galvarey was no more a Harper than a treant. His actions betrayed him, and all those that followed him!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The garish Hold, his political agenda—he was merely using the weight of the Harper name to promote himself. Tell me: What did he offer you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Then I am better for it. Call me traitor, but I have followed the spirit of the Harpers. You are the traitor, and if the events were known, others would see!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of course not. Despite the ambushes, you will still be able to claim the moral high ground for your actions. What happened to you, Dermin? I do not know you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: At the cost of the innocents. That is always the way.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It certainly disrupted you. The innocents also include Harpers that have died thinking they were fighting for the right cause. Galvarey's cause. Your cause.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As was yours, though I suspect you have been gone for years.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Save it, Dermin. I have no more guilt about facing you or any other sent on this fool's crusade. You are the betrayers, not I. I know this in my heart.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I did not wish to do this. I did not. We are in the right, but why does it still hurt?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Heh, you and your jokes make me smile far too often, even when I do not want to. People will think I am getting soft.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Haha! Shush you! I'm supposed to be feeling bad about this whole thing. Oh, let's just get moving.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *snicker*

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I've sat through all of your little plots and plans. The least you can do is toss me a bone now and then. Yeesh, take their thunder for one conversation and they gets all touchy.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Let's get out of here. We've still got things to do.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, yes, you do what you can, not always what you want. The Big Little Book of Alaundo, right? Insightful.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sorry, I shouldn't be taking my anger out on you. Let's just get moving. I'll be all right in a while.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Heh, a wise move. I will not have this situation made trite. I may be in a foul mood for a while, you understand? Yes, I think you do. Thank you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are you trying to tell me, bard, that you do not remember us? You were working for that evil sorceress, Silke, when we ran into you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, you didn't have many thoughts in your head then, and it is obvious you do not have many now.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps you should go and soak your head within a bucket, guard, before you attempt to address me again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Obviously, if I did have a problem, you would be the very last person I would be speaking to, you selfish and close-minded fool.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You Amnian are too closed-minded about the demihuman kin that live amongst you in peace... they are not so different from you as you seem to think.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You certainly are not! And perhaps you should think, sir, before you speak such insults so candidly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Too... weak... I feel the curse within... Damn you, Ployer! I'll be cured yet...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Her cause seems just, and she is druid kin of a sort. Let us do our best to aid.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will find my own way, and... *cough*... and damned if I won't live to see you die on this path you've chosen. Ah, I will waste no more breath on you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You wish me gone! I— *cough* I shall seek help on my own. A word before I go: Beware your friends. No doubt they will eventually treat you as you treat them.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He was irredeemable when he was on trial. He lives because he "donated" to the state. I will make good use of our next meeting, but not just because of his attack.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No! You do not know. This is not the time for this conversation, child.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What are you babbling about, Imoen? I am not in the mood.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You saw this? You watched as it was done?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Stop, I don't want to hear this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Be quiet, child! No more!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You've seen some horrible things best forgotten. We all have, in our day. This will pass when we... avenge the fallen and... bury this son of a bitch.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Imoen! Enough! Let's go!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We have done nothing to you. I see that you are an elf... We are prisoners here, as are you. Perhaps if we could—

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nonsense, he was secretive with everyone. We just had... mutual acquaintances.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So... I see we have a name for our captor at last. Irenicus, is it? Tell me, dryads, why this Irenicus would go to such lengths to keep you three here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Surely you won't refuse them the chance to return to their forest? It takes no effort from us and would be a kindness to them. Think it over.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is monstrous that one would do such a thing to a servant, to lock him away in an eternity of pain. It offends nature.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nature does not intend her creations to live past their allotted time. Certainly not this forgotten servant, tormented and then left for dead, but not dead.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I wonder how this master came to live such a life that he abandons much of it? The fault of ill-considered magic, no doubt. We shall see when we find him.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will do as they decide is best. While kind enough to give the beggar a coin, there is no need for them to give away everything they owns.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: For shame, that you could speak to a child so. Have you no compassion for the helpless?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Take care. I have heard of these Cowled Wizards. Spellcasters of the highest order, the only magic-users allowed here in Amn, I believe.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Greetings to you, good sir. I trust all is well?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am not here in an official capacity, suspicious one. There is no need to worry.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The gnome is dead. How he was able to perform these great feats of illusion will have to remain a mystery, it seems.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That was unbecoming of you, to be so forceful with one of such a lesser station. But I suppose you shall do as you wish regardless.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It sounds like there is a trade of flesh going on, but questioning this man will get us nowhere. Perhaps a more thorough inquiry is called for.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I doubt this man is a prisoner. More likely a slave, prohibitions notwithstanding. A revolting practice wherever it is carried out.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: There is nothing wrong with a noble task duly undertaken. And perhaps it will be enjoyable to see you in a greener setting, dwarf.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I hope you intend to go to this village soon. A visit to greener lands would be welcome after our trek through this crowded city.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You may wish to reconsider your refusal. This may be a way to overcome the slavers here for good. It is the honorable path, if you are interested.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not overly concern yourself with the pursuit of precious metals alone, Korgan. There are other matters that we must consider here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ah, a chance to strike at the heart of slavery here in Athkatla. Think of it; you could make a difference, if you wish. At least for a while.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A thoroughly despicable man... and an equally despicable place. This is the sort of thing that comes naturally with civilization, it seems.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, he is not. He has no interest in anything you might have to sell, woman.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Druids would not attack a town without cause. It would be a very extreme reaction, and is definitely something we should investigate.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will not, Korgan. There is a disturbance in nature that we are to restore... I will not have you swinging about, heedless of the consequences.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You may wish to reconsider, Korgan. Doves can carry several diseases, and I wouldn't wish you vomiting and cramps simply for being an ignorant lout.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You're welcome to try, but you are not the only one trained in martial skill. Remember that in the forest, you are in my domain and at an extreme disadvantage.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I thought such childish antics to be above you. But if it makes you feel better, I suppose I cannot stop you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I cannot believe you would partake in such cruelty. I refuse to watch this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So... I see we have a name for our captor at last. Irenicus, is it? Tell me, dryads, why this Irenicus would go to such lengths to keep you three here?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Get your hands off me! So help me, I'll...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Where are the mirrors, the switches to pull to show where he is hidden...? *sob* Khalid...!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Damn... damn you...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... no.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Damn you! I will have the heart of who has done this! I will tear their blackened heart from their... I will...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Shut up! No more words! Words are nothing!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Stranger! Nobody! I will not hear your words! Leave me!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No words! No more words! Save your speeches, save your proverbs! The only voice I wish to hear is... is dead! No more! No...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Imbecile! Affront to nature! What do you and your rodent know? What can you know?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Khalid of my heart, let my love... my love guide the way...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Khalid? Silvanus, let him hear my vow... If I must, I shall empty this city of all within to find his killer... So do I swear.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is my wont to do this, and I shall see that it is done properly. If you would assist, more the better. If not, be prepared to stand aside.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: She seems distant. Those are not Imoen's eyes. Not the one we knew, anyway.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: An excellent warning, if vague. I shall think on your words, though I doubt I shall alter my course. What will come will come.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Have you no sense of charity, dwarf? What is the sense of freeing such children only to subject them to starvation and destitution, then?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Really, couldn't you have spared a little gold for the child? You may have rescued them only to subject them to starvation and worse.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And one wonders how long you have been able to hide your arrogance and disregard behind a semblance of honor, Anomen. Helm would disapprove, I think.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I do not fear you, knight! Any moment you wish to meet on the field of battle, I will be there!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It comes as no surprise to me that an immoral dwarf such as you have a heart of stone, Korgan. I simply expect better from you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That you did, but there is a responsibility that comes with such actions as well. You might decide to ponder that at some point in the future.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: How sad, to have been kept prisoner in such a state. And by what? The presence in the sword? It does not make sense.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A puzzle, obviously. We must find the four things spoken of to unlock whatever mystery is hidden here. Who would hide something in such a fashion, I wonder?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I think it would be an excellent idea to get outside of the city and administer justice on such evil creatures. Tyranny is best matched with equal force.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I've fought many an ogre in the past, dwarf, and many other powerful evil creatures aside from such. You should be wary that I do not add you to the list.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ah, Gorion once said that he and some Harpers dealt a humiliating blow to a dragon in the Stormhorn Mountains. I was not aware this was the same one.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sure you have your reasons, but be not quick to turn down an offer of sanctuary. I am not eager to battle paladins without need.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Indeed. They seek your agreement before telling you what they wish you to do. The Cowled Wizards are not to be trusted, as you well know.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: While surely all murderers must be brought to task, I wonder what manner of justice the Cowled Wizards would apply. It is something to consider.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We will have to be careful with the Cowled Wizards now at our heels. But it is a righteous cause, and another companion to stand at our side is always welcome.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And well you should be. This is coward's work, despicable to the core.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are mistaken. I do not bear that name, and I will not. The greater balance bids me here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are lucky we did not allow the creatures to complete what they started. You are a fool, merchant, and should think with your head instead of your purse.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I think I should like to walk through this place when we no longer need anything from the devil we know.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I am not always frowning, I... oh, go away, child. Why are the children of this city so annoying?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmm... wait one moment... do I know you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. A Zhentish agent, if I recall, but one of no consequence. Pay him no heed.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ah, yes. The infamous capacity for drow compassion is revealed once again. Ignore her, and let us get this task over with quickly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ah, Berinvar is not a Harper, but I certainly am. Will you treat my guests as friends and answer? I assume the guardians are spectral harpists?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He and the others seem preoccupied with the trinkets around their necks. I find it odd I have not heard of this before now. Harpers do not often wear symbols to make themselves *more* noticeable.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This person makes me ill. I suggest we move on before I ignore the greater balance and return him to the dust.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No doubt you have plied your trade on good folk as well in the past. Your balance will come in the end. Nothing goes unpunished.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The confines of the city do much to chisel at the sanity of its inhabitants, but I wonder if there is some other force at work. We had best be wary.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I'm not sure the lieutenant should go alone. We have evidence of the culprit, but we know nothing of his ability. There may be danger we are not aware of.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: His work? What does he speak of? Quickly, we must stop him before he escapes!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This... this place smells heavily of death, and the evidence of it is all around us. Step carefully, for I believe we enter the workshop sanctum of a madman.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have little doubt, that we will also find Lieutenant Aegisfield somewhere herein... Hopefully, the man is still alive.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are mistaken, but I care not! Khalid will be avenged whether you stand aside willingly or not!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I should think not! Child, surely you are better than this? Are you certain of this choice?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That was unnecessarily harsh. I can see that we shall be at odds more often than not, drow.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Such a lack of compassion is unseemly for a knight. Would you have others judge you as quickly?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: One should not turn away an offered hand so quickly, but I would be wary of its secretive origin. Perhaps we can find Imoen on our own.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Shadow Thieves? Perhaps we shall finally get answers as to their interest in us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: My own Harpers have used us. I should have suspected... the gaudy necklaces, the invitation. Ah well. If Xzar was doing as she said, he deserved his fate.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I was wondering when you would turn up, Zhent. I had suspected our parting would not be permanent when last we met, and it appears my suspicions were correct.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Be wary, the Harpers will not brook interference lightly, and this Zhent likely holds only the worst of intentions in his heart.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, if you wish to investigate what has happened to the spy, that is up to you. I suggest caution and perhaps some common sense.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If the Harpers will even speak to us, which I doubt, they certainly will not reveal what they did with the halfling. Best not to ask about him directly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is good that this is the final of these tasks set for us. I've no taste for bounty hunting, but let us find this thief and have the deed done with quickly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, this is an odd structure for the Harpers to erect. I have never heard of an opulent base such as this. Secrecy has always been the watchword before.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am a Harper, Meronia. May I be allowed to speak to these guardians? I assume they are spectral harpists. Perhaps they could satisfy my... curiosity.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes... I've noticed the amulets you wear. I've heard of the Harper pins, but nothing of these. Is this a local custom?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your memory is selective, Red Wizard. Why do you now work with Shadow Thieves, and what is your connection to our capture by Irenicus? Khalid is dead, and I will have an answer!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: How about conscience, dwarf? Or morality? Perhaps you knows what is best.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not make us laugh, thief master. We have heard of your guild war. You would not approach outsiders if your own house were strong and solid, hm?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You would abandon Imoen here? I would rather leave myself than have you cast her away in this place. It is not right.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You would leave a person in obvious distress to his own devices? I would have expected better of you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: But it is the truth, is it not? I am a Harper myself, and we simply wish to be treated as guests. you did bring you your poisoned friend, after all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That was foolish! The Harpers could have helped you. *sigh* But I suppose you will do as you always have, stubborn person.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am a Harper, friend, and I think I see where this is heading... Is all this really necessary?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: *sigh* If the Harpers have asked this task to judge your worthiness, then there is no way around it. Let us proceed and be done with these "creatures."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmm, I am surprised they are letting us in, even after all this. I warn you, be polite. Our reason for being here is questionable enough as it is.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmmm... it's nice to know there's a "softer" and "sweeter" side to you... "Eddie."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And all feared the Slayer, for it walked like a mortal, but in its wake there came murder, and in the future, there was death.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is a dark place to meet this woman, and I sense an unnaturalness about her that is disturbing to me. Step carefully.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: How does she know of our link to the Shadow Thieves? And what would they think of this meeting? Be careful, our lives may hang in the balance.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Boldly said, creature, yet you do not face us. you have been underestimated by far better. You will rue the day of conflict when it comes, I think.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Step slowly, you do not look well at all. How do you feel?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have your money, but you could have avoided the inevitable reputation of a kidnapper. Sometimes I think you act without due consideration.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are you well? I am growing very worried about you, you know. I should not like to lose you in this evil place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your lips move, but there is no sound. you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Nature is not so vindictive, fool. It cares not who prostrates before it, it cares only that the balance is maintained.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is the hilt of a long sword. It appears to have been forged by a fine craftsman, even though the blade was broken off long ago and the pommel is obviously missing a large gem. STATISTICS: Weight: 2

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You would have killed me if I had let you. You would have left me to rot in this place.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I'm not sure you should try to control it. We must distance you from it, not embrace it. We will make do despite the danger.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, you should not be alone during this. We will get through, I am sure. We just have to keep going, no matter what comes.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You are not the only one affected by this! It is so hard to see you...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Please, let's just keep moving. We'll get through, I'm sure of it. Really.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are you well? It would only be fitting to take some time to rest. You have been through quite an ordeal.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Very well, but keep me apprised of your condition. Imoen supposedly went through the same ritual, but she did not seem to suffer from sudden attacks like that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That is troubling. I do not know what effect having the ritual had on you, but it does appear to be different from what Imoen suffered. Odd.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am glad that you have chosen this course. This cult stinks of wrongness, an affront against nature that must be stopped!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You align yourself with a temple that threatens its followers? You would bow down before a vindictive god? You are strange indeed.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hold, do not be foolish! You there... how can we be certain of your innocence? Why are you here if you are no longer members of the cult?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This... this is the same child-killing gnome from Baldur's Gate! I remember! For the greater balance, his head must be brought to the authorities!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I... I understand. It is an avatar of a faded god, left guarding an item that has waned in power. Loathing has replaced the worship of his followers. A lingering fate.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have no love for drow, or for this drow in particular... but it seems that she has done nothing to deserve this fate other than simply be a drow. This is not justice.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Is that what you see as justice? I sensed great sadness behind her darkness. With balance, she might have been... well, who knows?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Truth be known, I am not opposed to having Viconia travel with us. Remember, though, that many will think less of us simply because she is here.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Are you... yourself? That was... the Slayer! You became a form of the avatar of Bhaal... but the god is dead...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This is not right at all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We had best move quickly! The mages you have let loose will need direction, or they will be impossible to control.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We must be subservient. To them, we are lesser drow and no doubt under suspicion. Any sign of disobedience would bring scrutiny upon us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The drow have a harsh culture, one I am not overly familiar with. We must harden our hearts if we are to blend in. The alternative is discovery and death.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Just what are you on to? You think I am blind, not to see your foolish behavior with the drow woman? Why would you play such an idiotic game...? Do you not remember our situation?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Jealous of a simple drow that turns her eyes up at you? Is your opinion of me so low? I merely think that flirtations will gain nothing and endanger us all.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is a foolish one. Drow enjoy neither affection nor intense attraction. Sex is nothing but a game to them. To indulge would be... disappointing.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh? I am disappointed. Indulge your carnality, by all means, if it means so much to you. I shall say no more on that subject or any other.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You spent quite some time in the drow woman's chambers. Care to elaborate what you were about, as if I did not know?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I suppose that is true enough, although I can think of several lies you might have tried for our sake. But I trust you enough. Let us just... move on.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmph. You are just the sort to lie to me about this. And that this makes me uncomfortable is even worse. I think I prefer to be on my own for a time.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know the purpose. Simple self-gratification, or do you maintain there was no way to avoid the situation? Ahhh, enough... I do not want to hear any more.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am sorry too, and disappointed, but I suppose it could not be avoided... with you being male and in this guise. I shall... attempt to forget about it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No? Very well. I shall endeavor to keep my shrewish opinions to myself, on this and all other matters regarding us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Hmmm... out so soon? Did the drow woman not dig her claws into you successfully? That is good. I shudder to think what might have happened otherwise.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: How can you refuse so coldly? I will not stand idly by. Nalia... we will aid you, as will you, I am sure. What is the problem, precisely?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A bitter end to a terrible man. We did well, I think, but I am not certain that all has been restored to as it was. Do you feel any different?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It... it is not finished, is it? This is death... and your strange power has dragged me here with you....So be it then. We stand together until the end.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I understand plenty already! This place reeks of corruption and deceit!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Rest, child. None of this group shall harm you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh? Is that what those retching noises were? I thought that perhaps there was a wounded seal somewhere onboard giving birth.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Okay, I'm not quite so concerned about this little freak. Rule as you will, little tyrant, just as long as it is from a cell.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I suppose we could expect no less from a simple pirate. Begone with you then, scoundrel. No doubt you would only bring us more trouble here than we need.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: These are the same creatures we fought when we entered the lair of the vampire that was aligned against your own guild. Bodhi must be nearby indeed.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do you spend all your time in the guise of others, child? Do you not take solace in the balance of your true self?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: War? War amongst the elves? What could that mean? How could even Irenicus start such a thing? That would bring nothing but ruin!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As much as I should not trust his advice, he may have a point. There are powerful mages above who may be the difference between life and death.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: What revenge do *you* have, wizard? You killed my Khalid with no more thought than one would give to a fly! I shall have *my* revenge! Nature's fury shall strike you down!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You think us fools? You knew your ship was scuttled when you first spoke to us, didn't you? You seek to use us somehow!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: She sees the universe unrestricted. It is amazing that she manages to be as lucid as she is.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And what would you have to do with that, Edwin? Perhaps if ego were all that was required.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I should have known. Once again your peculiar destiny has drawn us into something. Even the shark gods flounder in anticipation of your arrival.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have never known you to be so judgmental, paladin. Surely you do not label all sahuagin so? Condemn them all to death and you are no better than they.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Must it come to slaughter, sahuagin? Your priestesses speak of your entire people needing your blood... Have you attempted to resolve this with the king peacefully?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Well, Viconia. It would seem you carry less weight than you thought. He questions your worth, rightfully so.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A most underhanded maneuver. Although I am sure it is no less than Phaere might have planned for us. There is an ironic justice in this, no?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: So... a war? Open battle between the drow and the surface has not occurred in... eons. With a greater demon to back them... I truly wonder why Irenicus would do this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You would commit such a sacrilege against nature? Had I known, I would never have accompanied you! No, I will not let this be!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: As much as I despise this form, it does seem to have captivated our friend here. He seems fearful.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Despite what she says, we may be able to use this situation to our advantage. Perhaps there is no need to kill Solaufein. Consider this, at least.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Drow roaming the surface, even the most noble, should expect an occasional misunderstanding. I am sure this can be worked out... I suggest you try.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: This drow is well respected by the Harpers. I will not assist you fighting him. I will return to Athkatla; consider your idiocy before we speak again.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: An excellent idea. Adding Drizzt and his companions to our battle against Bodhi will certainly tip the scales. You show great wisdom.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I know of this one, from the Harpers. A drow of good alignment and heroic reputation. He is deserving of respect.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A fine sentiment, Cernd, though we may be forced into more trouble than we wish.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: That was close. We must make an effort to act as we appear.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The Seldarine? The collection of elven gods led by Corellon Larethian? How would he ever propose to join such ranks? Mad! Mad!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Your soul is borrowed, and it shall be returned. You are a blight upon nature, and you shall be destroyed!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Edwin, in some another time... some other place, such a comment would get you a beating of mythic proportions. It may yet.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No more platitudes, Irenicus. You have taken much from all of us. Now you die your final death!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I will not let you do this! You will not murder those that beg for aid! Who will follow me?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It would appear that neither of us have much of a choice in the matter. We must trust one another.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Of course, my Lady Adalon. do keep quiet.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is unfortunate that they did not offend you in some way. We might have been spared the headache of this journey if they had to face an angry silver.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: To become such a hated thing... I do not look forward to that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You should have made more of an effort. We have an obligation to destroy you, as if we needed more reasons.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Knock him on the head? It is obvious this lout has no compassion for others and no inclination of how nature must be protected. Ignore him.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You can't seriously consider poisoning this font. If there is evil there, we must cleanse it. To destroy it is sacrilege! I will not allow it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, no! This is evil! You poison nature itself! I shall not partake in this... who stands with me?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: These people are slaves, mentally as well as physically, controlled despite themselves. All we can offer them, unfortunately, is a quick death.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: There are many who easily sidestep laws through wealth. Perhaps, in this case, it would be best to see why the law has failed so.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The law may not be able to do anything, Anomen, but such men as this Saerk always trip over their own schemes. If he is responsible, he will pay, as you say.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Too many of the wealthy escape justice, yes. If you are sure that Saerk is responsible for the death of your sister, then we must ensure he pays dearly!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: By... by the gods! You foolish man! Can you say that this young woman was a murderer as well? You have murdered an innocent!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have the feeling we are intruding on a very private matter. I feel uncomfortable with our intrusion; perhaps we should leave...

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A fair line easily used by servants of the wizard themselves. We have been imprisoned and worse, and given many reasons to distrust strangers we encounter.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You have extorted a payment from Raelis in return for our help. I do not agree with this decision... it smacks of selfish greed.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We must be calm. Vengeance will only bring conflict with the guard. To help Nalia, we must prove that our cause is just... there is no other way.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A mind flayer? Here? A spy perhaps, using its psionic powers to keep its secret. Strange that Jan's mad uncle should be aware of its presence.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You speak as if unaware of class distinction, and yet your manner exudes it. A sign of immaturity... perhaps adventuring is not the place for you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You speak as if unaware of class distinction, and yet your manner exudes it. A sign of immaturity... good, then, that you are sending you ahead.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You dare reprimand those who have died defending you? Even now they strive to protect you from evil you don't even understand! You could have been dead!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have no fear for his well-being, monster.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Where? Where exactly is it being put to good use? We are not to be played with, Linvail. I should like to see results, and I should like to see them soon.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Oh, how generous. Do you expect that to compensate while you delay our more important concerns? We have friends in need of rescue and vengeance both!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: And vengeance!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I see. You must be the rogue, Jarlaxle, that was mentioned to us, yes?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: A poor thing. We could have done better by these people with minimal effort. It is a better fate than what the drow had in store, however.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No. "Veldrin" would not be interested in such diversions, male. I... as a female, I command you to stand away from him. Slug.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Yes, declare your loyalty, Viconia. When you eventually betray us, I will hold your statement up as proof of the untrustworthy nature of your kind.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Cernd, I would normally bow to your wisdom, but in this matter, I think you are... mistaken. I make no protest; I merely wish to state my opinion.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We are bought off yet again. I do not deny that they are the best chance we have to find our quarry, but we had best do their little chores quickly.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Thank you for your opinion, Korgan. I'll just place it over here where it can collect flies all on its own.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You baffle me sometimes, Cernd, but I bow to your wisdom on this matter.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Not just thieves, but traitorous thieves. Our associations sink ever lower in Aran's service. Let's get this over with.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I have heard some in the Harpers speak of it. It is more than a prison or supposed asylum; it is a place to forget people that are "troublesome."

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Long ago, I promised to assist you if your adopted father fell. That promise has not expired, nor has your worthiness. I stand with you if you will have me.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: It is not necessary to say anything. I know what comes next... I know what may happen. To either of us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We have been through too much to let that stop what you must do. For all the pain that losing Khalid brought... I would not give up our years of good works.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Let us regain your soul and make you whole again. And what comes after... comes after. I look forward to it... should the gods prove willing.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: No, Valygar, we shall not give up on you. The Cowled Wizards believe much if they think to use everyone as they wish. You will receive nothing this day, mage!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You will hear the name "traitor" many more times today, Yoshimo, but let me be the first among the group to spit it at you!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I no more want the trip than you do, so I will not force and I will not leave, but I cannot rest easy until we go.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If you wish, Dermin, you may return whence you came with the message that "Jaheira the Harper" is dead.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Perhaps we will meet again, but I shall not look forward to it!

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I find it odd that this Irenicus would leave of his own volition. And why take Imoen when it is you he is so obviously interested in? Perhaps he expects us to give chase?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We must step carefully then. We know little about him... whom he was fighting, who took him, or even where we are. We seem to be drawn into machinations not of our own making.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do not be foolish, Minsc. We must know our enemies... and the extent of our danger here... before we rush into anything.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You can't work with such as this. Have you forgotten all that Gorion taught you?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Take a moment and think. What would Gorion say about this pointless bloodshed?

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Careful. We want to walk into the gorge, not fall into it.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Beware. You cannot trust a tanar'ri.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: An evil one.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: We must proceed with caution. The Red Wizards are devious. They will expect retaliation.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Animals should be wild, not kept as pets by wandering heroes. Tell Barad the gift is appreciated but inappropriate.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: The half-elf's magic may represent a threat to the balance, but I think she would do less harm with us than without us.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Ha. My advice has the virtue of being in the common tongue, at least. And I can take the shape of a bear when I please.
