Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Refusing to engage with him further was wise. I sense that he is a part of the magic that infects this forest.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: You disappoint me more than I could ever say. I am glad Gorion is not around to see this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: Do you think it wise to spend so much time with Dorn? He seems to have taken an unhealthy interest in you.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He is not to be trusted.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: He is a murderous half-orc with an unquenchable bloodlust. He is incapable of the feelings you and I possess.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: If you intend to take up with a barbaric half-orc, I must end this.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am relieved to hear that.

Speaker: Jaheira
Text: I am glad Gorion did not live to see this.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo points, I punch! Is very simple relationship, but it is effective.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We do good things here! All will remember the heroes that are Minsc and Boo and you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Nonsense! All enjoy the sight of heroes. We'll be the talk of the town for days! Wave to the nice people, Boo. Wave to the nice hamster, people. WAVE!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes! Lead evil by example, and one day we need no longer put the boots to those that stray off the path of goodness into the muck and bile of villainy and track great bloody footprints across our lily-white tiles! Boo will have clean wood shavings, you evil bastards!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Good has no need of low profiles! There is no shame in boasting if one follows through, and I am not about to keep my voice low! Perhaps Boo will, but not I!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We follow the path that surely leads to glory! Boo is proud to be here, I can tell.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then say it louder! We must inspire fear in evil! Quiet tales of hamsters are foolish, but a man and his hamster that tear evil limb from limb? That's scary!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Now you are speaking the language of Minsc! Next we must get you a hamster! Or perhaps an ice weasel, whatever your tastes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It's good that I know you are kidding. I would hate to have to cleanse my own party of evil. Always strive to be on the safe end of the justice boot.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I know I think clearly because Boo tells me so. That is enough for me, though it never seems to be enough for anyone else. Their loss, for I am content.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: As long as some are scared and tell the rest, that is all that matters. Come, we must press on against the tide of naughtiness. Mind your step.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't understand the reference, but Boo enjoyed it. An omen of good things... or of horrible and humorous death, I am not sure which.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: These acts will place our names in the songs of skalds and bards from here to my home! There can be no doubt.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will not tolerate actions such as this! We should strive to be just and fair.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: When making a glorious egg dish of goodness, I understand some eggs must be broken. But actions such as this are... simply deplorable!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Words are just loud air. Actions must take priority in my mind. A phrase might cause some discomfort, but it is good deeds that cause evil the most pain.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That is all that can be asked. A crusade might be better, but few have the focus required. I will be the example if anyone wishes to follow in my wake.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A hero needs no profit. A sword is just a few coins; armor is only a few more. No, it is evil that needs gold to fund their machinations, not heroes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I, uh... I could use a bit of a lie-down... lest I drop Boo on the battlefield. Have we a healer near?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes, that would be best. I should not like evil to get the jump on a weakened Minsc. We must be at our best for the fight to come.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc is no weakling! I have survived more than you could bear! It is just unwise to let wounds go untreated! Enemies will find their work half done already!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I know this, but Boo worries.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ugh! We must rest and get healthy. It would not do for us to be caught unsuspecting with Minsc in this kind of shape.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not get through many battles without injury. Why is Minsc always on the front line taking damage?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Perhaps I am a touch quick to combat, but I temper my temper with common sense about who I should attack. What? I do too! Why does Boo snicker?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: If I protect more people by being at the forefront, then so be it! I shall charge in an instant and make my enemies sorry they were born as bad as they are!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: If that is what you think, then you do not know Minsc. I never cower! Boo does, but he fears being underfoot. I do not! I am the over-foot placing evil at end-of-boot!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: If you don't care about your party, then it will be you that is left on the battlefield eventually! I can only fight as long as I have my health...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is a fine friend, and powerful in ways you don't let yourself see! To insult Boo is to insult all things small that try hard. Oh, and Minsc as well.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is no rat, tiny one. He is a space hamster, and he will go for the eyeballs of children who call him rat.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No. I have had enough of tiny people trying to steal Boo. Away!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Stupid is as stupid does, young one. So says Boo.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Boo is NOT for eating! Boo is mighty and wise and probably quite stringy. Er, and he is my companion!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am sorry. I am only for Boo and my witch.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am not impressed by fighting slaves. But I would CRUSH any true opponent who dared to face me!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You are coming from Rashemen? I remember it fondly and hope to take Boo to see it once I have completed my dajemma.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No. Boo is my hamster. And Boo is my friend.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes? You talking to Minsc?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says such a sphere will not fit into my pocket. If I can't carry it with me, it's just not a good buy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes indeed. Boo is exceptionally smart for a hamster. Smarter than all the hucksters in Calimshan.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: He mutters occasionally about fellow hamsters that will kill you all, but he is just moody, so don't worry. See how he glares? Shhh, we should leave him be.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Nobody cheats Minsc! If somebody dares to cheat me, they are in for a boot-stomping adjustment to their moral value systems!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am always willing to help those in need! I will give your troubles the one-two boot-stomp of goodness!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I sometimes feel lost, but Boo tells me where to go. Boo points, I punch! Well, Boo actually just kind of runs, but I still punch! Yes, sir!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo knows everything and is ever so willing to help others. You... you are kind to animals, aren't you? Rodents in particular?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo doesn't like rats either. Something about their tails makes him... edgy, and you don't know creepy until you've seen an edgy hamster!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes, Boo is friend to all. Such greatness, packed into a small, furry bundle of goodness.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Eh? You are speaking of me? How do you know this?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No. I do not act. I fight, and fight for real.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I am sorry, little halfling.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Why does this impish halfling jump around me like that? Is he dancing? Boo likes it when halflings dance around!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I think this is good for you. Boo also is sending his congratulations.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I might join your hunt another time, but seabirds make Boo uncomfortable. It is best I spare them his wrath. Yes, best for all! But I must go now, little one.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is no pet... he is a fine companion for Minsc. But he seems to like you anyway.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Perhaps people just need a swift kick in the punctuals!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, I seldom have time for reading. Too much work to be done!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Why? In beloved Rashemen, if things don't work, we encourage them with a loving backhand of productivity!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A thinking game! Minsc knows the answer then! Evil ends in death, because I put my foot in its backside!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oops. I apologize.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is a foolish question! Who travels with you? Minsc does! What else matters?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oops. I apologize. Next time, I let Boo answer.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You cannot have Boo, little girl! But you may pet him and make pretty cooing noises if you wishes.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is not food. Maybe I should throw you to the cute little meat-eaters and see how you like it?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is silly! Buttons are not how one escapes dungeons! I would smash the button and rain beatings liberally down on the wizard for playing such a trick!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Irenicus? There is a special place in my bootprint for him, and I shall fill it in the name of Dynaheir! Such evil to keep forest spirits locked away!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I would hate being forgotten in a bottle. It might depend somewhat on the type of bottle, but overall I expect the effect would be similar. It is not right.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We must help this child! I will find who took his mother and teach them a thing or three about decency, respect, and keeping their hands off of people's parents!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Owl wizards?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is no risk! Not so long as we have swords and braveness to the brim of the tall glass of goodness! Right, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will protect my witch! EVIL SHALL SUFFER AT THE HANDS OF MINSC AND HIS WITCH! WOE TO THOSE WHO WOULD BRING DANGER TO AERIE!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We must aid him! Evil stands before me and demands a quick kick in the posterior!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I will not stand and watch men carting slaves! THEY SHALL FEEL MY BLADE AND BOOT AND BACKHAND AS WELL! GO FOR THE EYES, BOO, GO FOR THE EYES!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Hmmm... the sphere is awfully big for only 500 gold pieces. It might be a good bargain. What say you, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We shall go and save the village for the boy! I will crush the evil! All of the evil! Even the small, rodent-sized evil... although that is more Boo's job.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: They throw this man into a pit with a wild beast? This is a crime against man AND nature! They will surely feel my wrath for this travesty!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We are going to free this warrior and his people? This is a task of great honor! We shall be great heroes for this, heroes doing heroic things for all to see!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This man is a great evil if he does such things! The shining blades of goodness must be raised against him! Justice demands a painful, pointy thrashing!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: More children kept as slaves! Boo is outraged by the evil that leaps about this city like a hot-footed weasel! We must save the children, we must!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It cannot be! I would sooner tear out my eyes than strike down innocent animals! Well, perhaps only one eye... but do not think me any less incensed!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will not! I will fight to save each and every creature, dwarf! The forest feeds and nurtures, and I will not hesitate to put a birch up your backside!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Why? I have never heard such head-biting villainy, except perhaps in the larger cities, but what passes for entertainment these days is not for me to decide.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Your strange jest is wearing thin, dwarf. I suggest you sate yourself with chicken in the proper place and time, and leave the woodland creatures as they were.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You insult you, and you insult Minsc! There will be liberal butt-kicking now!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You pay for dogs to fight in this filthy place? You cannot imagine my anger! I shall find properly heroic companions elsewhere if you continue such outrages!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Irenicus? There is a special place in my bootprint for him, and I shall fill it in the name of Dynaheir! Such evil to keep forest spirits locked away here!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What? No, Boo is no glove! Boo is a hamster, and far more than a handful if he wishes, tiny woman!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A brave man has fallen here, but that is no cause to hurl insults at the living. Here, Boo shall comfort you.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Pirate Lord? Such a name does not conjure images of righteous behavior. Stand still a moment and let Boo have a look at you.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo will soon have you figured out. You certainly seem friendlier than I would think a Pirate Lord would be. And where is your peg?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Your peg. A proper pirate has a peg, whether a leg, arm or... uh... some other expendable extremity. And a parrot.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Certainly! As I have my Boo, so too must you have your parrot. Boo likes parrots. They could wrassel.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Little Imoen, it is Minsc. See, here's Boo... Boo, stop that. It's Imoen. Sure she looks a bit... stressed, but it's still her.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't know what's wrong. Boo is all jittery. Something is different about Imoen.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oooh! This is most goodness of news, is it not, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What? They have no shame in trading lives of others? Evil, meet my trusty sword! Sword: MEET EVIL!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ooh! To take swords against monsters of great evil! Already I feel Boo wriggling in excited anticipation!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Of course it is Boo. Boo is always happy when opportunities for heroism come! We shall crush these ogres, and rangers and hamsters everywhere shall rejoice!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I... would strike for goodness... but this dragon is so... so... It would not be cowardice to come back another day with bigger swords!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We must find this fiend who steals children and disguises knights as monsters and apply a butt-kicking for goodness! All must be avenged!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This changes everything! A fellow ranger plunged into peril by evil wizards! Even Boo cringes at what we have been sent to do! this cannot be!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A fellow brother of the woods! Is this the man the wizards have sent us to kill? tell me it is not so!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You... you would not lead Boo and me astray! We do good things; we are heroes! This man lies, I say, and I shall fight with you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! I will not allow you to kill a fellow brother of the woods! You have become evil, and I have allowed it to happen! No longer will I stand by!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Be welcome, brother of the woods! Together, you and Boo and I shall stride forward to crush all evil in our wake! Woe betide evil!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Me? No, Boo would never allow such a thing! My sword is meant only for being firmly planted in the heart of evil!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: WHERE? Where is there a rat? Oh, you have frightened Boo with your screeching. Calm yourself, Boo. See? We are leaving the loud woman.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: *sniff* Ahh, even Boo cringes from such a foul odor. Surely this instrument will never make beautiful music again.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: They... they attack this funny man? Why? This evil must be stopped with generous doses of sword-swinging! Come, Boo, we go for the eyes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Heroes of goodness need no warning! Where we tread, evil trembles in our wake!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I would rather have given a sword. Give a man a fish and he eats for a day, but teach a man to fight and he can chow down on the meaty marrow of evil!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Wha-aat? This is the evil man who steals skins? He must be stopped! He must be stopped, or all who have skins will sleep in fear!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We shall answer your attack, though even Boo sees no sense in it!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I understand none of this, but if the one who killed Dynaheir is beyond, Boo and Minsc will make short work of you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We don't need money to find Imoen! We are heroes! We will crush wizard after wizard to find her! Hmm, we should start soon if we hope to be done by dinner...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I remember you! And so does Boo! A craven wizard who travels with his untrustworthy halfling!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, I never step on toes... except by accident, maybe. If Boo had me step on toes for real, toes would gloriously be flying everywhere in the wake of my sword!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You shall be called what you are! You are an enemy of fair, departed Dynaheir and therefore an enemy of mine! You shall be destroyed for the good of all!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will not speak of sweet Dynaheir in this fashion! Terrible hamster justice will be wreaked upon you! GO FOR THE EYES, BOO, GO—

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I... no. No, our cause must not be disrupted. Righteous fury will wait for now, but one day the wizard shall pay for his words with blood! So swears Minsc!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My anger can only barely be contained! Speak to us as if we are anything but heroes, wizard, and you shall be receiving the rented-mule beating you deserve!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Dynaheir's enemy comes with us? Please, say it will not be so! And if it is so, let it be brief! Boo shakes with such anger I cannot blame him!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We do the bidding of thieves now? Ehhh... this churns my belly like a hamster running endlessly within a wheel. This can't be a good sign.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Rashemen is my home, but I haven't seen it for many moons. I am on my dajemma. I... failed my last witch... but nothing will happen to Aerie! Nothing!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, it will not be! let Minsc and Boo take their chances here. Do not abandon Imoen to this place.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Poisoned and dying! The tragedy of it sings in my skull! We must hurry and deliver this man to safe harbor!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Such an offer from this woman sends chills up and down my spine like angry weasels... but you will know what to do. Even Boo is confident of this.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is an option that bears no questioning! you are a champion of good, just as we all are! Always must we take the choice of righteousness!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Tell me this is not so! No heroes would commit such an act! I could never look Boo in the eyes again if I took part in such a thing!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My hamster's heart is crushed that you have fallen so far! How could this be? It is my fault, all mine, for letting it happen!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I... I must leave to drown in my sorrows. If you pick yourself up, I shall be in that Copper Coronet. It seemed like a grand place for adventure, oh yes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is more like it! A rescue from the hostage-takers! All shall quiver in the wake of our righteous fury! Yes, Boo, show them how they will quiver!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We will charge into the midst of the den of thieves and fling them about like pancakes! All that is glory shall be ours! And then breakfast.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Those who bury the living must be buried by our righteous fury! Woe betide those who would flout justice! So says Minsc, though "betide" was Boo's word.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You would keep this woman a prisoner? Boo is not convinced that this is right. I agree that it smells of evil. Bad you! Bad!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: So the woman is freed? What need is there to collect a reward from the man? Are we not heroes, you and Boo and I? This is most confusing.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is more dangerous to call Boo a vermin, as he may leap upon you and show you his true warrior spirit. Nothing can contend with the might of an angry hamster!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: An assault on the most foul and evil of creatures! Such a victory shall make us heroes to be sung of throughout the land! Glory will be ours, oh yes!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: The priest turns on us! For shame! Boo will gnaw on his eye sockets for this travesty!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We are stopping now? Why are we stopping? We are heroes, and heroes must face the final enemy and win over all!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo remembers! Baldur's Gate! Neb the child murderer! You die, gnome, you die! RAAAAAGGGGGHHHH!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Tiny has met a god before this?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is my stalwart companion, and he says that if you must wear the skins of a dead animal around your neck, the evil sharp-toothed weasel is a good choice.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo fight with swords and teeth for goodness, not for countries. We are heroes, not soldiers, funny man.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: He attacks? Such a display of wrongness fills even Boo with disgust! For my hamster, I must land a blow for goodness!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: They... they will not burn the pretty elf? There must be no burning if she has committed no crime! This is not justice! we stop this travesty!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We do not rescue her? What was her crime? Maybe darker elves are not all good, but surely not all are totally evil? I am... confused. What does Boo think?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We have saved her, and she is our responsibility. What if she was captured again? Neither Boo nor I could live with ourselves. No, she must come.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is worried that these inmates will harm themselves. We should see that they are safe and make sure they each have a hamster of their own.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That last part was my idea.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: True heroes demand no reward, and Boo knows you to be a true hero! We need only know what foes we are to face before the boot-stomping can begin!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Say it cannot be so! we must rescue the nice man's child and be off! Unless... unless you have some plan? Minsc is confused.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Has you truly fallen so far? A glorious rescue has turned into a nightmare of epic proportion! Minsc and Boo will stop you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo knows! Do not stow thrones in grass houses!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: The evil wizard is dead! Once again, Boo and Minsc and you emerge as victorious heroes! Much rejoicing and celebrating must be commencing soon!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, such a glorious death in battle for Minsc and Boo! We were well on our way to the great fields and halls of Rashemen, but we felt you needing us, so we came!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This young minstrel has lost his wits and his songs? Minds are common enough, but tunes of merit are few and far between.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes! Such fire and conviction! A pity there are no actual enemies to warrant the screaming, but good show anyway. Boo applauds!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It is okay to come out now, Boo. The pale woman is gone. You can stop shivering too. You are a warrior hamster, so be brave! Brave!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: All good peoples hang their head in shame! We are betrayed! The sailor man brings the vampires back amongst us... there shall be a mighty reckoning for this!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not think Boo is too thrilled about you borrowing his face. He only has the one. You don't hurt those you mirror, do you?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ughh, my head spins. So many quick words from so many small sources. Countersong, Boo. Relax my frazzled nerves.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What does everyone stare at? Boo's churring calms me down. See?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes! Revenge! Revenge for precious Dynaheir! Tremble, wizard, for the mighty Boo will have your eyes! RAAAARRRRGHH!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That's a much shorter interjection than Boo has become used to, Jan. Are you ill?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! No collar! I will not be collared by the smelly fishmen! My warrior spirit will not bear such a thing!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo too has small teeth compared to fish-men. But they hurt just the same when they latch onto the eyes, yes sir!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: My skin may not have scales, but it has seen many suns come and go. Boo thinks you could use some sun too. Then you might not smell so much like wet laundry.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Don't worry, Aerie. I'm here to protect my witch. Boo too, though I think he would leap to protect anyone in distress. It's his heroic nature, you know.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo bristles at his words. I don't know the language, but he is insulting us for certain!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I cannot believe my ears! You would stand against all that is good and right? You shall suffer a terrible vengeance for this!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Yes! Hello! Minsc is a drow! And Boo is a shadow hamster!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Another drow who speaks strange words! Even Boo bristles at his obvious lies! If you fights, then so does Minsc! Prepare for liberal butt-kickings!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ooh, another drow! I begin to see them everywhere, ever since the Underdark! They are so vicious even Boo cowers. What will we do?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I do not cause trouble! I merely seek it out and put the bootheels of justice to it! Ask Boo!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is impressed, Korgan. You remember well to act like drow.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: For Dynaheir and all fallen comrades, for what is good and right, for all these things shall Minsc and Boo fall upon you today! And we shall taste victory, evil man!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Neither do we, right, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What's so funny?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I grow tired of shouting battle cries when fighting this mage. Boo will finish his eyeballs once and for all so he does not rise again! Evil, meet my sword! SWORD, MEET EVIL!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Worry not, Viconia! Minsc and Boo stand at the ready to protect! Right, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! You will not attack the small dark ones! Minsc and Boo will not allow it! And I hope no other will either!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And then Minsc will disrupt them with his bootheel! Yes, speak more of this evil-smashing partnership!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo shakes with disbelief! Such a crime will not go unanswered!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo would have found her wherever she tried to put her evil foot! That's what we do!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Irenicus is the most vile of villains if he dared destroy a whole city! I can't believe that, and I have believed some amazing things, let me tell you!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Groves are wonderful... you wouldn't really poison one, would you? Boo suggests that perhaps you are tricking this evil little man. Smart thinking, I agree.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: This is the evil killer who takes skins that do not belong to him! We have discovered him! We must take the bootheel to his ways!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: To decide between justice and honor! Oh, it is a conundrum that would tie even Boo up in knots. I do not envy you. My decisions are usually easier than this.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! Minsc did not come here to kill young girls! You cannot tell us that the young girl was anything but innocent! This is not right!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We serve no evil mages, no sir! But Boo looks upon you with suspicion, little man. How is it you come to be here? Never have I seen Boo's whiskers quiver so!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then you too know the hardship of being set into a maze like a helpless hamster! We are comrades in peril! Boo asks what you propose we do next, little man.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What is this? Minsc and Boo were just getting into this wonderful story when it was sadly interrupted. A work of mastery, this is!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Someone has rattled the little one's brains? Hmm, I know how she feels. If this was done on purpose, he deserves a mighty kick in his posterior at the least!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Helping others is good! What a nice little girl you are. Would you like to see my Boo? I think he approves of you too.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Helping others is good! What a nice little girl you are. Would you like to see my Boo? I think he approves of you too.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I don't wish to alarm you, but Boo is absolutely fretting about your condition. Are you well? Fear in Boo is uncommon, and usually weasel-caused.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We can rest if you wish. I do not understand what Irenicus did, but Boo has said that it was traumatic, and I will guard if we must stay here a while.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: That is good. I will guard if you need to rest. It is the least I can do, since I could not stop Irenicus.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then Minsc and Boo will turn their attentions to more important things, like staying alive. We should get moving if you are through with your headache.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo does not think so, despite your kind words. You smell of treachery. Prove me wrong or face the boot!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You'd have bought a trip to the graveyard if you had spent the money we needed to rescue Imoen! Minsc and Boo would see to that!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: When all others stand numb, it falls to Minsc and Boo to make comment. you...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo just soiled my backpack.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo does not favor the odds, but I have no doubt we will succeed!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo would have sensed any treachery long ago! She fights well with us!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo concurs! We must hurry and dispense with this errandry so we can get to the fighting of greater evils more worthy of my bootprint!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo will protect your street, Aerie! You will cross it for your pleasure, not for fear of it!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then let us get going! Boo and I have several talents we will unleash upon it!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc owes much to the killer of Dynaheir! I stand with you! Nowhere shall I go until the heel of justice has been firmly imprinted once and for all into the wizard's evil backside! Nowhere!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! We do not abandon comrades! Never could I look Boo in the face again after such a thing! We shall give the evil wizard a certain boot-kicking instead!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: A slap in the face of our trust! A sword to the heart of our confidence! A boot to the prunes of our friendship! Perhaps I go too far, but Boo is absolutely incensed!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc and Boo are the greatest of warriors, small one! I will crush your foes into little foe-shaped chunky bits! Who dares pick on you? Just point the way!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No foes? I am relieved. I trust those who prey on children no farther than they can be thrown, even if I manage to throw them pretty far, and throw them I shall!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What? Boo is outraged! See his fury! It's small, so look close. Trust me, it's there. What is wrong with your village, small one? How can we heroes help?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc has been inside out and angry before, and it is never a good thing. Sometimes it frightens even Boo.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh! Minsc has never been crazy, no sir. Being inside out was bad enough! Is there more, little boy?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Then heroes are certainly needed! Heroes like Minsc and Boo and you! Where is your village, small one? Together we will save the day!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Nothing removes fear better than a good sword and a swift kick in the evil! We shall go to your village and do what heroes do, right?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: There is always time to save the day! Don't worry, small one, we will go to your village as soon as I restore you to their senses. That is my job.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Kicking the posterior of evil is never a fool's errand! Hmm is not their usual heroic self today. An evil influence? Or have their thoughts wandered elsewhere?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Since you are out of their mind, I must step up as a hero should. We go to your village as soon as you are better. So swear Minsc and Boo.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Er... Boo wonders what you need a warrior for when you have no foes?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo is curious and keeps bringing up the question of when we will travel to the Imnesvale village, and I heartily agree! We are heroes, and they are in need of heroes—it is a match even Minsc can see!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We must go where evil is in most need of a beating, so Minsc will leave that decision up to you. Still... we must not disappoint the little boy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Did Minsc miss something? Did we already go and save the Imnesvale village? Boo demands that it is not so, but I cannot remember. Surely we would not shirk out heroic duty for so long! It cannot be!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: We come because the little boy, Delon, said that there was evil here in need of a butt-kicking! And good for us that we have our boots on, yes, sir!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, we can't leave this place without having destroyed all evil! Tell Boo this is not so! Do not destroy a young hamster's innocence!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Wolves? Ogres? Witches? Oh my! It is too much for Minsc's poor head to comprehend! Which of these are evil? The edge of my sword shall find the truth!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Oh, most glorious day! One step closer we come to being true heroes, yes indeedy! Even little Boo's fur stands on end from his anticipation!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc agrees! It would be the essence of epic heroing! Dead dragons should litter our path wherever we go!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Bah, omens are for those that pay attention to their surroundings, not for such as we, right, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Anyway, go out of city that way... Keep on the road, turn right at big church, and you will be out.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says not to blame myself, but Boo is a hamster and not as concerned with honor.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Actually, this changes very little. Minsc is happy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And perhaps my Boo as well...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: And a good sword...

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Ooh! And the occasional buffing, for the armor, you understand.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No, this cannot be! The murderer of Dynaheir flees from righteous butt-kicking vengeance! And he takes Imoen with him too!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Something must be done! We must find this evil wizard! All that is goodness cries out for this! Even little Boo, although he cannot cry out quite so loudly.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: No! We must go quickly and save our friend Imoen! The wizard may be leering over her evilly even now!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: He's not that ugly. Boo's seen much uglier half-orcs. Haven't you, Boo?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Are you calling Boo a fool?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I'm with the hamster.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says it's rude to diminish a bride's radiance on her wedding day.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: What do you think, Boo? Isn't this a nice tree?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo doesn't think this is a nice tree.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: I think Boo is right.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Speak for yourself! Boo is the warm center of the universe that I orbit during my slumber each night!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Trusts?

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo dislikes this place. These people are trapped in a wheel that turns and turns, but never moves forward.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo dislikes this place. These people are trapped in a wheel that turns and turns, but never moves forward.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: It's all right, Boo. They're dead, but I'm sure they're not bad—

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You were right, Boo. They weren't nice at all.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says smoking isn't healthy.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Minsc is torn! It seems only fair that you be able to walk with a small animal to advise them, too. But Minsc also fears for Boo... Dings might have a bad attitude toward hamsters.

Speaker: Minsc
Text: Boo says we should find the hairband! Boo believes the children are our future!

Speaker: Minsc
Text: You will need an advisor, heir to the throne! It is Minsc's opinion that hamsters make the best advisors.

Speaker: Portal
Text: I see. If you are loyal followers, then I have little choice but to fight. You shall not take me peaceably to my doom at the hands of my ancestor, of that I am certain.

Speaker: Portal
Text: My proposal is that we return to the city and enter the sphere. That way, I will know if Lavok lives. If he does, we can exterminate his ghoulish existence once and for all.

Speaker: Portal
Text: I refuse. I prefer the goodwill of the Cowled Wizards and the reward for you.

Speaker: Portal
Text: The wizards have not been entirely truthful. How do you propose we solve this?

Speaker: Portal
Text: The wizards will not rest until they get inside the sphere. And one cannot hope to stand up to the them for long... at least not without steady hands at one's back.

Speaker: Portal
Text: Who are you that makes you so special? How do I know you are not lying to me?

Speaker: Portal
Text: Wait! I've a proposal, if you are but willing to hear it!

Speaker: Portal
Text: I am the last of the Corthala line. That may mean little to you, but it means plenty to Lavok. When Lavok left Athkatla in the sphere, he was already many centuries old.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Suspended, I be... I am... dying... dead. No matter, I must be your cruel dream as you are mine.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Strangers be ye? Aaaa... things have gone... bad... since I have died. Threaten not the master, for you shall... surely... perish... Driven is he, and power he seeks...

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Prisoners be ye? Truly I have been... dead, but not dead too long. I seek... release... I have been alone for... too long. The master can take nothing more... I am forgotten.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Neither, neither. I am... between... the master has forgotten me... not killed me.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Please! I am alone here. For too long, alone. If you must... escape... release me...

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Eternal... life... was to be my reward for faithful service. The master has suspended me until he can cure me... return my youth to me...

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Release... yes! Master! I—I no longer wish to come back! Let me slip into the oblivion that has been denied me! Please!

Speaker: Rielev
Text: He has forgotten because he does not wish to remember... what was taken... I barely remember myself.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: They may know how the master exits the complex. Will you take these cells to revive them and learn what you can, in return for this path to freedom I have offered ye?

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I thank ye... go and leave me to oblivion at last.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: You are heartless. I again feel hate.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: Leave me! Take the crystals and return me to oblivion!

Speaker: Rielev
Text: This... unit that contains me is powered by cells, by crystals. Take them and I can sleep... die... again die at last.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I was a... faithful hound to the master. A friend, even. I was... dying... or dead, I cannot remember which. Truly you are a stranger to this place.

Speaker: Rielev
Text: I thank thee. Go and leave me to oblivion at last. Sweet sleep...

Speaker: Rielev
Text: You are heartless. I again feel hate.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: So, there is sanity in all this madness. If you are not in league with the evil that dwells in this unholy place, Yoshimo begs your assistance.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I share your sentiments. I have seen much here that has disturbed me. I myself am a warrior with no evil intentions. Please, I would welcome any assistance you might offer.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am no fiend! I am Yoshimo! You know, Yoshimo?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I do not know how long I was there before awaking.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I do not know a way to escape this place. Perhaps we could search for this exit together.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Perhaps then Yoshimo's predicament won't seem so funny!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: At last, an admirer! I do not know a way to escape this place. Perhaps we could search for this exit together.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: What do you need to know?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: If you are ever in Athkatla and need some assistance, I reside at the Copper Coronet, an inn of some renown. First, however, a warning...

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: You have changed your mind? Shall we draw our blades with a common purpose?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I agree. Welcome to the Copper Coronet, my home here in Athkatla. What can Yoshimo offer you? Information? Contacts? Equipment? Perhaps you would like me to join you?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: The barkeep's name is Bernard. He will sell you high-quality equipment at a reasonable price. If you have the time, though, I would suggest the Adventure Mart in the promenade.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I would be honored to wield my sword for you.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Oh, taker of my honor, do not return to torment me further. Unless you have come to take back your cruel words, I ask you to leave now.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Welcome to the Copper Coronet, my home here in Athkatla. What can Yoshimo offer you? Information? Contacts? Equipment? Perhaps you would like me to join you?

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: It is good to see you again.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I did not hurt the nymph! She released me from the fairy circle. I am a free man again and ready to join your party.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: After the nymph released me, I ran to catch up with you and had a little run-in with a worg. The worg wounded me.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: It is the truth! I would not harm that innocent nymph! She released me from the fairy circle so that I could rejoin my companions. You must believe me!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am pleased to travel with you again.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am very sorry to hear that. You shall find me in Athkatla should you need me. I will be staying at the Copper Coronet. Travel safely.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: When you have thought about this and realized your error, you will find me at the Copper Coronet in Athkatla. I will now take my leave of you.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: These little beasties keep coming in through the portals. Perhaps if the portals are destroyed, one could defeat the beasts that have already come through.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I have noticed that each wand is locked into the pedestal and could be removed if one had the proper key. I know not where these keys are. Let us begin!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Shortly beyond that chamber, there is a hallway that contains several wands mounted in pedestals. They blast all that walk before them.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: It is actually quite uh... embarrassing. My profession does not leave itself open to those who are not wary, yet somehow I was caught unaware.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I came to Athkatla years ago from Kara-Tur to seek my fortune. At some point, I went to bed in my room at the Copper Coronet, and I awoke in a strange room with a very sore head.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Maybe you should try to face the perils of this place alone!

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am unsure. I may have been drugged when I was brought here. I may have been unconscious... either way, I do not know how long.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: If that is how you wish it to be, then go ahead and forge the trail. I will follow your path once I have rested a bit.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: You do not know what happened! I must leave now before my anger rises any more.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: One more thing... you will find a wide hall before too long that contains several wands mounted on pedestals. If you walk before these wands, you may be killed.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: I am not sure how I came to be here... like you, I suspect. I have been trying to find my way out, but I was wounded in my attempt to do so.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: In the next chamber beyond the one in which we stand, four portals lie. Each of these portals releases a little cackling fiend which tries to kill me.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: In the next chamber beyond the one in which we stand, four portals lie. Each of these portals releases a little cackling fiend which tries to kill me.

Speaker: Yoshimo
Text: Shortly beyond that chamber, there is a hallway that contains several wands mounted in pedestals. They blast all that walk before them.
